TopicTitle: NPC base, buildings, abandoned rockets and shop.

Articles.Content:
1.
Add in game random generated shop with parts, economy and currency. (i.e. trading). 
Good example is Empyrion - Galactic Survival, No'Man Sky, X Rebirth/X4 Foundation, 7days to die.

2.
Abandoned various ships and buildings randomly generated.
So that they can be robbed and taken to their my base.
Good example is Empyrion - Galactic Survival, No'Man Sky, Astroneer, Space Enginers.

Because it's interesting.

Edited October 9, 2019 by cgw

Shops will have no point in KSP 2. KSP 2 is not an RPG space adventure game anyway. 

Abandoned space ships would actually be interesting, but stealing their parts? There's no point to that.

Also, you cant really compare KSP or KSP 2 to games like No Man's Sky, Astroneer, etc.

There is not a single game that is like KSP or KSP 2, except for simple rockets. Ksp is a very unique space game about building rockets and exploring space in the lego rocket you built. KSP 1 and 2 are space simulation games, not space rpg adventures.

There was a mod that did that, but the development has stopped awhile ago. I doubt it will be revived for KSP2.

The current game rewards certain traits in players, and that is what makes it appealing to them. The game throws up challenges, and rewards planning and foresight.

Plundering wreckages and buying parts at outposts undermines that element. I can see how encountering a chance wreck could advance scientific research, but that’s as far as I think it should go.

Yeah what the others said. 

Star Theory have stated that they intend to make exploration more interesting, with more stuff to discover and presumably more tangible gameplay rewards about it. That's very cool. It requires more features on planets, and perhaps derelicts could be a part of that. 

A trade economy is right out though, KSP isn't and shouldn't be like any of the games you listed.

We could steal copper wires on presumably abandoned ships.

Thus the shop could also be made useful.
